article.title: SN 2016jhj at redshift 0.34: extending the Type II supernova Hubble diagram using the standard candle method

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the vertical red line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The epoch of spectral observation in the observer frame.
The epoch of spectral observation in the rest-frame.
The peak brightness of SN 2016jhj in the r-band.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary method used to determine the redshift of SN 2016jhj in Figure 2?
choices: Measuring the Doppler shift of the Fe II λ5018 line.
Comparing the spectrum to a library of SN spectra using SNID.
Identifying and measuring the redshift of host-galaxy emission lines.
Analyzing the shape and width of the Hβ λ4861 absorption line.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the brown point at the top right of Figure 3 represent?
choices: A SN II with the highest measured Hβ λ4861 velocity in the sample.
A SN II with the lowest measured Hβ λ4861 velocity in the sample.
The average Hβ λ4861 velocity for all SNe II in the sample.
A SN II with a significantly different Hβ λ4861 velocity measurement between the two methods.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the observed dispersion (σ_obs = 0.27 mag) in Figure 5 correspond to in terms of distance uncertainty?
